page.title: 06A COUNCIL HOUSE, HARROW.
page.content: The average age of a council house is about 35 years old. The{entrance hall}usually gives access to all ground floor rooms. The main room is the{living room} where you could relax, watch T.V. and where you could also eat. In the{kitchen,}we cook meals, wash clothes, plates cups, etc. If the kitchen diner is big enough, you could eat there. Most council houses have three {bedrooms}where you sleep and rest and also store clothes and toys. In the{bathroom,}we wash ourselves and take a bath. There is an{attic}which can be called a loft. This is where you can put things that are not in regular use. There might be a{cellar}where some people put wine.
